Reviews.Title: “Great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rachet79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located near a lot of the major sights, for example the blue mosque and Aya Sofia, it is close to a tram stop to get to the sights that are further away. There are also a lot of restaurants in the vicinity. The staff are friendly and very willing to help with any queries, it also has free wifi and a good breakfast buffet which is served on the top floor roof terrace with a view of the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean's 7 Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martina D
Reviews.Content: Excellent. I highly recommend this hotel because it is ideally located for visiting the city. The hotel is clean, the service is great and the staff very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: haijyu
Reviews.Content: My husband had a heart attached since we arrived in Istanbul. I was panic. I am glad I choose the right hotel because every worker in Ocean's 7 gave me a lot of help and supports. I really appreciat them. I high recommand to everyone to stay this hotel. Julia

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Launch Spot for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Maggie J
Reviews.Content: This place is perfectly situated between all the major sights (Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cistern, Topkapi). Easy walk to the tram station to get across to Taksim etc. The staff is very kind and helpful, the rooms spacious and cleanâ€”it's an incredibly deal for such quality and I'm only afraid they're going to realize this! I stayed here two nights while doing all my sight seeing and Grand Bazaar shopping (easy walking or tram trip) and then moved across to Beyoglu for the rest of the trip and I definitely recommend doing something similar, if not just staying at Ocean's the whole time! Don't let the hawking restaurant owners surrounding the hotel get you down, the restaurant is quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “best direction to everybody”
Reviews.Author: marwa y
Reviews.Content: I stayed five days in ocean's 7 hotel. Since the hotel is located in a nice and calm area, and in the same time it is close to any thing someone can be interested to visit, I could see alot of attractive places without beeing obliged to walk too much. moreover, the hotel is run by a nice and friendly staff. the service was excellent: clean, confortable and quite rooms with the eccess of wifi, delicious breakfast that one can take in the terrace of the hotel to enjoy the awesome view, to be in the top of the whole area to see the famous blue mosque and the Bosphorus.. breafly, this hotel is the best direction that somebody can get.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable holiday”
Reviews.Author: 350Daria
Reviews.Content: Being in Istanbul with my boyfriend we spend wonderful holiday at Ocean's 7 hotel. We took there incredibly good impression,because of high level of comfort.Beautiful interior delighted us..Room where we stayed was full of harmony and light. The hotel was associated as a castle for kings. All the furniture chosen with good taste.Pleasant smells accompanied us everywhere with every step hotel was made us more and more surprised. Ä°t so tasty meal i had never eat something better.Ä°t many entertainment centers....super...oh. Our bed was full of life and love!!!!!At the end of journey we were incredibly happy and we didn't want to live Turkey specially hotel and all our friends with whose we met at 'Castle'. With impatience we are waiting next holidays to come back to our second home and excellent hotel OCEAN'S 7 HOTELLLLLL!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best buy”
Reviews.Author: JeanLuc P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days in November 2011. and I must admit I didn't expect much from a small hotel in Istanbul and was very pleasantly surprised For the price of less than 50â‚¬ for double room you get a decent sized, warm and very clean room, adequate breakfast with a view of the sea and the Blue Mosque, superb location and courteous staff. And a little tip to the manager: some quiet music at breakfast would be great

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SwaroopR R
Reviews.Content: Great Place, One minute walk form many important attractions.The staff is helpful and courteous. The place is run by a few brothers who are very friendly and helpful. They also own a nearby restaurant which offers good food. It is a neat and safe place to be with good breakfast. would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ive been to ,i have travelled around all of asia !!!”
Reviews.Author: aslan b
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 1 week and all i can say is that it was outstanding ! it was so clean , all the staff were very polite,generous and helping , i stayed in a very comfortable room , amazing view , and also great weather . the bathroom as clean too and the person at the reception was very helpfull , i was very confused of getting out of the area tofind the nearest area out and the receptionist gave me his number , helped me out , gave me a map and also called a cab for me . i really enjoyed staying there and hopefully someday i will come to turkey but not for a business flight it will be a holiday for me and i will come to this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “real history real best poÄ±nt on hotel servÄ±ce”
Reviews.Author: p0lat0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in July. Great value, incredibly helpful staff, delicious breakfast and breathtaking Bosphorus and Blue Mosque view! Thank you Ahmad very much for your help in production our fotokast! You are a great manager and a wonderful man! Your smile, friendliness and cheerful way of being remembered today. I recommend to all without exception! Pics and sound on our web site

Reviews.Title: “%100 rocumented hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: chayoda_ann
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel with my family and we we have got enjoyable time 'they were kind with us and all the workers trying all guest as family member of them we belived this and we saw on this hotel real service kindly and we have never seen the hotel desk give city infarmation for free and by easy transport to get samewhere' thansk again and again we will rocument all of our firends to be at this hotel. noi

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MNF_11
Reviews.Content: Oceanâ€™s Seven Hotel, Istanbul, July 10-15, 2011 We choose this hotel based on the positive reviews but we were sorely disappointed. Our first night we were in a tiny room on the top floor. Before dawn we were awakened by loud noises coming from above our room, as if furniture was being dragged across or thrown on the floor above us. The next day we complained and we were glad to be given another room on the floor below, which was quieter. The room was also slightly larger, but still extremely cramped and poorly designed: we had to keep one suit case on top of the refrigerator (which was itself in terrible shape). There was no chest of drawers and we were barely able to unpack during our 5-day stay. The electrical outlets were hidden behind a closet that we had to move to get access to plug in laptops and phones; the curtains were see through so that light came in early in the morning; the bedding was poor quality. For the first day and a half we could not get on-line; management advised us to use the connection of the hotel across the street and gave us its access code. Eventually they corrected the problem but the connection remained slow and erratic. Hotel "services" in general were unreliable and unprofessional. According to a sign posted in the lobby (and as repeated to us orally by management) breakfast is served on the terrace from 7.30 to 10 a.m. but when we arrived one day at 9.45 all the breakfast items had been put away. When we questioned the attendant there she first told us we were too late. When we pointed out the time on a clock she grudgingly put a few of the items back. When we later complained to the management we were told that they must have just "forgotten" about us. The following day we were awaked at 8.30 am with a phone call from the hotel and told that our breakfast was ready. We had not requested a wake up call and did not appreciate being awakened. By this point we realized this is a very amateurish operation and we needed to explain to them that we did not want to be called in the morning unless we asked to be. Nevertheless they called again the next morning at 9.30 to tell us that breakfast would be over in half an hour. However, on our last morning when we did ask for a wake up call so as to be sure to catch our taxi to the airport, we received none. Luckily we had set our own alarms. On another occasion we returned to our room late at night to find that (apparently when the room was made up) the air conditioner had been turned and left on and the room was freezing; the window had also been opened and left open, which we did not realize until the morning, after the resulting street noise had disrupted our sleep. Most of the staff was friendly and clearly trying to be helpful; they just seemed completely clueless about what running a hotel means and what travelers need. Their English was also generally poor to non-existent; at one point they called over an employee from the hotel across the street to provide basic information (the location of a pharmacy). The location is very convenient; it's in the heart of Sultahnamet and near all the historical sites. There is a view of the blue mosque from one end of the terrace. There is some street noise which can be somewhat controlled by closing the windows. Contrary to the hotel description, there is no bar or restaurant at the hotel, nor is there an elevator; there is an affiliated restaurant on another street around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: lmussa
Reviews.Content: wooow,, clean rooms.. beautiful view,,near sea, varity kindes of food, friendy people, and willing to help,, i will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomedation and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lmussa
Reviews.Content: the hotel was perfect,, a car picked me up from airport,, rooms are clean,, varity kindes of food, wonderfull atmosfere and friendly people,, willing to help, and wonderfull sites around. advise every body to go there.

Reviews.Title: “The World worst hotel (Hotelman is cheater!!!)”
Reviews.Author: Kedicik
Reviews.Content: My book was 45Euros par night and I stayed Ocean's7 hotel 4night. I was surprise when checkout time. 180 Euros to 1800 Euros !! rewritten when the payment. I said " I can't payment". They are threatening, the violence now seems to be...... After returning to Japan, appealed to the Turkish Embassy. They said " Ocean's 7 hotel is middle class hotel. It's impossible". The incident will also report at Turkish Touristm.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place I Ever Been :-)”
Reviews.Author: maja30_31
Reviews.Content: The small,charming hotel have first of all wonderful staff,the people are nice,helpfully and very friendly. Ocean7 is located in old town Sultanahmet,in just few minutes by walk you can reach Blue Mosque,Hagia Sofia,or Topkapi Palace,around the hotel are to find lat of restaurants,romantic cafes and nice pubs. The hotel have a nice restaurant,which is located two minutes by walk from the hotel, called Ocean7 too,food is really wonderful and staff very nice,friendly and with a sense of humor :-) From the terrace you can admire the sea on one side, the other Blue Mosque, a magnificent sight! Warm, family atmosphere! I recommend anyone who wants to explore Istanbul !!!

Reviews.Title: “we will back again”
Reviews.Author: angel_dvd
Reviews.Content: thank you very much for the kind service and thank you for all of your help to all guest this my rewiev not just about us i saw you service to all of guest we never see on the recepsion desk give infarmation all of the city by maps the guys who are work at the oceans 7 do it for for all of guest and our trip be much easy and comfort we feel at home i dont know the travel what we need more then this service we got it and we rocument all of guest to try this hotel thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great and great”
Reviews.Author: Kochisar
Reviews.Content: We were left from isranbul ten years ago realy we traveled all the world but we havent saw the service same we get et the oceans 7 hotel they made all fell guest qame at thz house thanks again carrea & ahmedo

Reviews.Title: “thanks to oceans 7 from paris”
Reviews.Author: memo634
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of a Turkish friend in Istanbul, I stayed at this lovely B&B for a week in april2011. It is very conveniently located for tourist sites in the old town section (Sultanahmet) of Istanbul. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is serve-yourself from a wonderful array of options. The charges of about $80 for a single traveler were more than reasonable for the quality of the lodgings. I would plan to stay here again and again. and again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfort and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: LesCor
Reviews.Content: We were 2 families with teenage girls and enjoyed a pleasant stay at Ocean 7 at the heart of Sultanahmet. It is within walking distance to the waterfront, restaurants and shopping. The rooms were clean, very comfortable with 24/7 service. The staff were courteous, respectful and provided excellent guidance for self-tours, entertainment, shopping and other cultural aspects. Their restaurant down the street is very classy yet economical too. Kudos to the 7 brothers and staff and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “best choose on sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: fonrain
Reviews.Content: Saw this hotel labeled as a "find" in Frommers. What an understatement. We walked everywhere from this fabulous location, enjoyed cocktails on the rooftop terrace and slept comfortably. Though you had to pay, the shuttle to the airport offered by the hotel was extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cactusangie
Reviews.Content: We were there in late October but I have to write a review. This was our second trip to Istanbul (May 2010 was the first) but it was the first for our friend from Australia. We all agree we would go back. The location is excellent. Easy walking to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the tram. The airport pickup was wonderful -- better than on our first visit when we stayed in a more up market place for twice the price. I don't know if it's the norm for the pickup but we had onboard video in our car and it was a good introduction to this fascinating city. The rooms are a little on the small side but to be expected in a converted traditional building. A room with 2 singles seemed to have a bit more room than the double room. Rooms facing the street are a little noisy but what would you expect in a city? And the noise does die down around midnight. The staff are very friendly, helpful and courteous. Nothing was too much trouble. We ate twice at their family owned restaurant around the corner, again, courteous, and friendly service, and good food. We received the discount without being asked - how did they know we were staying around the corner? There are other restaurants in easy walking distance which we found helpful after a day full of sight seeing. Breakfasts were enjoyable and there was always enough to choose from. Maybe not enough seating in the cooler months when everyone wants to sit inside at more or less the same time, but it was manageable, I suppose this wouldn't be a problem in the warmer months. We would definately stay here again if we are lucky enough to visit Istanbul again, it is an amazingly beautiful and diverse and friendly city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing people”
Reviews.Author: Xavi77
Reviews.Content: We have been in Istambul for a week. We met them in their restaurant Ocean's 7 where we went for dinner every night. We haven't been in the hotel, but we can guarantee that if the hotel has the same staff,same cleanliness and the same service like the restaurant they have, the hotel must be also amazing. They were really friendly and polite with us. We recommend it 100%.

Reviews.Title: “greet hotel”
Reviews.Author: kacmaz
Reviews.Content: dont need to look other place in this area you ill find kind steff and enjot service.Ä± hope back again to stay here thanks

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophai
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel so clean, so kind, so hleping. so freindly every really Perfect. I love all everyone here Mr. Hamza , Mr. ahmet. Mr Abdullah everyone very take good for care me. Sure one day if i come to istanbul again i will back to this hotel and will recomment for everyone for visit this hotel. Good room Good food Good freind. feeling same the family. Thank you very much for Oceans 7 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “room overtaken by mold/mildew & staff verbally attacked and THREATENED TO HIT ME BY RAISING HIS HAND TO MY FACE”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: after reading all the great reviews, i was so excited to stay here, and then absolutely shocked by what happened to me at this hotel -- the condition of the room and how the management treated me. this is an AWFUL AWFUL HOTEL RUN BY AN AWFUL AWFUL PERSON. i booked 4 nights here, and the staff was overly kind upon my arrival. unfortunately i was placed in the top floor room which has an intense amount of water damage to the ceiling and walls, from rainwater leaking through the roof apparently. water was streaming from the light fixture as well as cracks in the bathroom ceiling. and the room is clearly regularly maintained this way (there are cracks and stains all over the ceiling, dried water rings inside the glass light fixture, and the bottom of it was completely melted/exploded out -- NOT SAFE). Â water drips on you from the ceiling while showering as well as standing to use the toilet. the room was consumed by an OVERPOWERING presence of mold and mildew -- both in visible patches (see photos) as well as spores in the air to the point that sleeping in the room will make you ill -- i spent one night coughing and woke up exhausted with headaches and a sore throat. Â i have an allergy to mold/mildew (who doesn't?) and this was not just a smell -- it was an overpowering presence in the room. as a side note, but all very secondary to what follows in this review, there is lots of noise from the street and the rest of the hotel, the curtains are see through and dont block light, the hotel wifi doesnt work & they told me just to pirate someone else's network from nearby, and the phone was sitting on top of a cabinet in the high corner of a room on a surface that had never been dusted. Â also, there are no "do not disturb" signs to use, so plan on being disturbed. HORRIFYING PART OF THE STORY: Â the next morning i went to explain to the staff that i had to leave because the mold & mildew was making me sick, and i didnt feel comfortable showering under water streaming from a light fixture. Â (the other light fixture in the bathroom looked homemade with exposed wires & sitting on top of a hole cut out in the cabinet -- but this one wouldnt even turn on). i explained that i was happy to pay for the night i had already stayed, but that i had to move to a different hotel. Â the first person i spoke with was quite shy and kind, but clearly not top level management. once the person who appeared to be the "boss" arrived -- he admitted that the room has water damage and mold because its on the top floor -- but proceeded to tell me that they "sell this room all the time and no one ever complains". Â which a.) flat out can't be true due to the room's condition, and b.) is irrelevant. Â he continued to say how my complaint was untrue, that it was not making me sick, that i was lying and if i didnt like the room, i should just say so... when i tried to explain my discomfort and the condition of the room (VERY CALMLY and POLITELY like a professional and sane human being), the man behind the counter started saying "shut up shut up shut up" the whole time i was talking, not listening to a word. Â i honestly thought i misunderstood, so i asked him if that's really what he was saying. Â he started cursing at me telling me to "take your [expletive] bags and get the [expletive] out of my hotel!", etc. i was so shocked and stunned that i got upset and started trying to defend myself (while he continued to be so verbally violent, aggressive, and mean), and the man STOOD UP, LEANED OVER THE COUNTER, RAISED HIS HAND LIKE HE WAS ABOUT TO SLAP ME IN THE FACE, AND CONTINUED CURSING AT ME AND THREATENING TO HIT ME IF I DIDNT STOP TALKING. the other staff member there was trying to stop him, saying "no no" but clearly he was afraid of this man, and was afraid to even say anything or do anything substantial. having just arrived in a very foreign country, i was extremely shaken by this and told the man i would be calling the police and also reporting this incident on all the online review sites. Â he was so smug the entire time saying "call the police, do it, i dont care" and cursing -- knowing that a tourist has no recourse or protection really -- what can you do? Â i live in NYC and the NYPD would certainly laugh at a call like this, they have things like murders and car accidents to deal with. so i took my things and left immediately, and went to the hotel next door to see if they could offer a suggestion of a place i could complain. Â they suggested the tourist police, but i decided it was best just to get out of the situation and not make things worse by further antagonizing the crazy man from Ocean's 7, or involving police in an unfamiliar country. this review is in no way exaggerated. unfortunately this shocking experience is 100% accurate. on my way out of my room i did see other rooms with their doors open on different floors, and they appeared not to have the same problems my room had. Â so maybe you will be lucky. Â  just know that if you are unlucky, that you may be physically in danger if you complain (no matter how polite or professional you try to be). most of the staff was overly overly friendly, but i know now they are only like that when it makes them extra money. Â if you happen to need REAL customer service (like when something goes wrong, or if it involves the hotel losing money, rather than making extra) -- you might get slapped. Â literally. AND after all this... he charged my credit card. please don't patronize an establishment that operates in this way.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable hotel - brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: julian23_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is managed by brothers Ahmet and Hamza who are very friendly and attend to every need. It was warm and welcoming when we arrived on a cold windy day. Tea was served whenever we asked! Right in the heart of Sultanahmet, we could reach all the main sites easily on foot . We also enjoyed eating at the family-run restaurant which served the best food we ate in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “like to comeback again”
Reviews.Author: nabilah12
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with nice staff, specially typical turk Abdullah. We did not feel Oceans 7 as hotel but home. Ahmet and Hamzas attitude was really so cordial we never can forget. We would like to come back again. I already have recommended many in Stockholm about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, great value & cannot wait to see the staff again!”
Reviews.Author: GaryChi
Reviews.Content: I read all the great reviews and felt like we made a good decision. . . AWESOME DECISION would be the better description. We were treated like kings & queens from the moment we approached the side walk. The rooms are small (like all the hotels I checked out) and the service is huge. The staff made us dinner reservations at the best spots and called ahead to let them know we are on the way (oh yeah, we got a discount at the 7 restaurant too!). Istanbul is a must see and Oceans 7 is on our must go back soon list.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Small Clean Friendly Hotel in Sultan Ahmet”
Reviews.Author: muchachitaoz
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean & comfortable & as the hotel is not on a main street, quiet. The staff were helpful & friendly, it's a family run place. Free quick internet. Standard Turkish breakfast. I would go back. Avoid overpriced Oceans7 Restaurant around the corner however.

Reviews.Title: “Stupendofantabulously amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Harsha_Thawani
Reviews.Content: Recent I visited Istanbul with my husband and a few friends. We booked Oceans 7 Hotel after reading all the good reviews about it. Our stay was actually more than amazing. The hotel is compact and good enough for a small group. All the historic sights like Blue mosque, Museum, Grand Bazar etc are not more than 5 minutes walk each. All the modes of transport are easily accessible. The staff of the hotel especially Mr.Ahmet was wonderful and added to the entire experience. He is a very friendly gentleman and suggested us a few good excursion options which were out of this world. This hotel is highly highly highly recommended for anyone planning to visit istanbul for a relaxing, comfortable and amazing experiece.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean's 7 you're the best!))”
Reviews.Author: Krugo_Svetka
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Excellent service, very comfortable and cozy rooms. Great place for good vacation! Do you like the view from the window - see the sea))) Located in the center, close to all attractions. Very convenient, close to everything. People who work at this hotel is very sympathetic and kind, knows a lot about his business. Truly, a wonderful hotel. Recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “I left Istanbul with leaving a family at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: marceospinah
Reviews.Content: Ok, so for anyone looking to visit Istanbul here is what I have to say: You definitely want to stay in Sultanahmet area...since it is the location of all the historic places...plus you have the Gran Bazzar near by, and it is just very typical!! And in order to have the perfect experience in Sultanahmet and in Turkey in general I recommend 100% OCEANS 7 HOTEL....it is the best in the world!! I stayed there the second time I went to Turkey...keep in mind the first time I went to a 5 star hotel in Taksim....but Oceans 7 hotel was far better!!! The staff is so niceeeeeee, they helped us with everything...they even called the airline for us when we had a problem, they were always prompt to help us and to make sure we were happy!! They always had a happy face!! The rooms were very clean, the cleaning lady is the best and she is always around...so no matter how late you leave your room she will be there to clean it! Breakfast was excelent...we even had an special breakfast the day we left...kind of like a going away gift!!! I mean if you want to stay in a beautiful, typical, friendly, super clean hotel and perfect location in Istanbul...that is the place!!! Oh...did I mention that the location of the hotel is so perfect that we never even once had to take a taxi....we walked everywere...even to the Bosforous!!!! I am 100% satisfied with this hotel and will recommend this to anyone out there who wants to have the perfect experience in Istanbul, Turkey! TeÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim Oceans 7 Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was "ok" and affordable... but I think you can do better”
Reviews.Author: citymusiclover
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, the staff helpful, and the rates affordable ($50 / night for 1), however - however, the bed was uncomfortable, they changed which room I was in (and moved all my stuff) during the day while I was out sight-seeing, and the view from the roof was a bit disappointing (you do have a partial blue mosque view, but not in the area where you would likely sit). It was 'fine' - no big issues, but I just think there might be probably better options in the same price range. I waited until the last minute to book, so I was just happy to find something acceptable. It is convenient to historic sights, but can also be noisy. However, when I shut the window and used the A/C it wasn't too loud for me.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: chicago62
Reviews.Content: took the family trip to Turkey in may, hotel has excellent location in old town Istanbul, very friendly and helpful stuff, cozy clean room, beautiful views of Marmara sea and blue mosque from rooftop, affordable prices, will definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for our best honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: bmoobig
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for your wonderful hospitality during our short stay here for our honeymoon. We only wish we could stay longer. Your rooms are beautiful and clean. We hope that one day we can make it back to this place when we had our honeymoon. ;)

Reviews.Title: “i like the hotel so muchhh”
Reviews.Author: beer12
Reviews.Content: when i come here i will be back the hotel again becase everything perfect for me and my family all like this hotel and i think the hotel will be good like this everytime and more important the receptionist so handsome nice to meet you Mr. ahmet

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Laurelija
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended this small and cute hotel for us and we were not sorry for anything. Service, rooms were really great, Staff was helpful and polite, also very friendly. What is the best - location. It is in a small n cute street in the heart of Sultanahmet, So all objects which we were interested in were easy to reach. We recommend this hotel with no doubts!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: mihoe
Reviews.Content: i didn't post any pictures because the pictures posted say it all...the best thing about the hotel is the amazing roofdeck. Sitting up on the roof for breakfast or afternoon tea (they have musicians some afternoons...) is quite unbelievable. You have a perfect view of the Blue Mosque. The staff was wonderfully kind and spoke English really well and the th staff

Reviews.Title: “A very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: familyoftrippers
Reviews.Content: On new year's eve we arrived in Turkey to stay at a pre booking at the Ocean's 7 . We were first taken around the corner to find that our room had been given to another who had turned up the day before, even after we had confirmed 3 times as they had said their database was not up to date. We were then moved back around the corner to the hotel behind the resteraunt where we were given 2 double rooms rather than the family room we had initially booked. Sounds good, but from my bed I could read the menu of the customers in the resteraunt and being new years eve it was not a pleasant place to be for the night, The light from the foyer shone through the glass door all night but the noise was keeping us awake any way so that was really insignificant. The kids had a room in the basement you wouldn't give to your pet. Permanantly running water in the bathroom, no electricity and a very strong smell of sewerage. We were unable to find other accom given the time of year. After 2 horrible sleepless nights our family room became available. This one I am pleased to say was quite comfortable, still looking onto the street but absolute luxury in comparison to the previous 2 night mess. We were offered a substantial reduction in our room rate given the conditions which turned out to be a whopping 5%. Fortunatly Turkey was such a wonderful place to visit we still had a marvelous time, however it would have been much better if it had not bee through blood shot eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MYCEngland
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed to stay at Ocean's 7. Especially, I was moved the excellent and lovely staff. They are so kind and helpful!!! If I visit to Istanbul again, I definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly / comfortable / Helpful..like being at home.”
Reviews.Author: bluebell_tdle
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 3 days trip to Istanbul by myself (a girl) and stayed at the Ocean 7's guesthouse which is the 'sister' hotel to the Ocean 7. Both hotels are clean and VERY close to the main sites in Istanbul. The staffs in both places are VERY VERY helpful and friendly and is always there to lend a helping hand. My luggage got delay for one day so the staffs helped me called the airport and offered me to use the phone/internet if I needed to get information for my luggage where abouts. The Ocean 7 guesthouse room is a good size, very clean. The bathroom is small but enough space to put your things and is very very clean. The Ocean 7 restaurant is also apart of the guesthouse which is good if you don't want to go far to eat. I would stay there again and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean's 7 Hotel is a place where you feel the family warmth”
Reviews.Author: RangerSven
Reviews.Content: the hotel's location, good price, and friendly staff who wouldn't hesitate to help you in every possible way (for free) made our stay in Istanbul pleasant. They also gave us many tips about places where you aren't robbed off, made it way less expensive. The group in which I was, was composed of English, French, Arabic and Spanish language speakers, and no one spoke Turkish, but we were lucky to have Ahmad there, who speaks English and Arabic. Despite the fact that this hotel is newly built, and obviously loads of money was invested in it, but we got the best offer (money wise) after touring almost all of Istanbul's old city center, where we saw many hotels and even very small and crowded hostels with dorms that were way more expensive than this hotel which has very good private bedrooms with super new furniture. I am planning to take my parents to Istanbul next year, and I will save myself the time and effort by going strait to the place in which I fell in love with Istanbul: Ocean's 7.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious service.”
Reviews.Author: Cimbom34
Reviews.Content: I have spent three days in Istanbul, and during my trip I have stayed in Oceans 7 Hotel. I must confess that the service quality has impressed me beyond my expectations. I have done many of these short boring business trips so the city I am in and the hotel I stay becomes quite banal. But this time everthing was different, thanks Oceans 7s' professional staff . It will be an experience I will remember and will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Second home in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: zack94
Reviews.Content: Ocean,s7 Hotel is only a 3 min walk from Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basillica Cistern, and the Sultanhamet tram stop. Gulhane Park, Topkapki Palace, and the Archeology Museum are also about 5-8 minutes away. Grand Bazar and other Sultanhamet attractions are all about 10 min away. Rooms in hotel are very clean and suitable size. View from the terrace level is great, nice touch.All over the hotel is very well maintained.Staff is very friendly.Guy at the desk gave us realy great aria suggestions.We recommend this hotel to whoever visits Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “friendly service, quiet street, great location”
Reviews.Author: matimati24
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two weeks in Istanbul, and stayed at Ocean's 7. Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, quiet street (at least in the off season - not sure what it's like in the summer), made it all a great stay. The hotel also owns/runs a restaurant around the corner which offers a 15% discount for hotel guests. Breakfast on the rooftop cafe is a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid - Very afraid!!!”
Reviews.Author: langoustine09
Reviews.Content: Having read the good reviews of Ocean's 7 hotel on this website, I followed the links and reserved, via Expedia. What I was given was Ocean's 7 Guest house (see http://www.oceans7guesthouse.com/). As you can see, there is no similarity between the two. Not sure whom I should take to task - Trip advisor / Expedia? To rub salt into the wound, when we reached ab 2.00 AM, we were informed that our room was given to another family by mistake. Hence we had to stay in a room with no facilities and were asked to use a filthy communal shower and toilet. I was reduced to searching for rooms to stay at 2.00 AM in a foreign country with a 3 year old kid in tow. Since we could not find a room at such short notice, we had to stay there. The duvet did not have a cover. The curtains were see through and there was a light just outside the window which was attached to a motion sensor that was triggered by wind (I am not joking - I had to personally remove the bulb as the manager could not). The next day, we were given a different room. It was bigger than the one we occupied the previous night. To say it was "no-fills" will give it some credit. The shower had a panel that had come loose and we could see the electricity wires. We were assured that the panel will be stuck back the same day - but I am sure you will find it has not been done yet if you visit the place. Since our trip was for a few days, and rooms were difficult to come by, we had to continue staying in the hotel. The service was poor - having to cross check everything the manager/owner said. The hotel and guest house are run by 7 brothers (hence the name) and they are out to make a killing. Beware. On second thoughts, go on and stay there. Everybody needs to experience this once in a life time.

Reviews.Title: “This is my second home in Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa-Weng
Reviews.Content: This hotel locate in a very nice place. It's near by Sultanahmet, so I can see Sultanahmet everyday. And also it locate in old town. It's convenient to travel around there and get some shopping from big bazaar. The service of this hotel also nice. They make every customer feeling like at home. No matter what u need, they will help you. And the room also clean and functional. It's nice to spend time in here when you come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable holiday”
Reviews.Author: samionIreland
Reviews.Content: We were very comfortable during the time we stay in Ocean's 7. The staff is very polite and warm, and the location of hotel is very appropriate to travel historical sites like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ã§ok gÃ¼zel !”
Reviews.Author: shewawa
Reviews.Content: I spend one week-end in Istanbul between two business trips and it was very nice to stay at Ocean's 7, this place being so close to the main area to visit and thanks again for Ahmet welcome and kindness. GÃ¶rÃ¼sÃ¼rÃ¼z ...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: DisplayID
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the car I'd arranged with Ocean's 7 to pick me up from the airport was there as promised; always a good start! The Hotel was super central; a brilliant location about 5 mins walk from both Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque. My room wasn't massive but it was plenty big enough for just me (and it was a twin, not a single, which gave me a bit of bed space to spread out on), more importantly it was spotlessly clean. It also had air con (which I didn't actually need at the end of Sep). Sharan was really friendly and helpful, a really lovely guy; he'd also responded really quickly to my email enquiry prior to my trip. At 140 eur for 3 nights I was very happy. I would definitely use this hotel again and would be happy recomending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, quiet street, very clean, welcome as family by Sharan & personal. Great value. Just go!”
Reviews.Author: Greenc0untry
Reviews.Content: We were there the first week of October 09. We were picked up at the Airport, so appreciated. It heaven did not matter to us to be on the 3rd floor without a lift! On the 4th, (this is not written on the Hotel's site) , there is a room for breakfeast with a full view of the Blue Mosquee!!! We had a twin room, small for American Standards, but enough space for two. Bathroom very clean. Rarely, have we been treated with such warmth and received so much advices in different fields. For the price, a bargain. Thanks so much Sharan & personal. Inforgettable stay. Louise Clermont Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend Oceans 7 to everyone, Sharan & staff go out of their way to help you.”
Reviews.Author: PeonyNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oceans 7 in September 09 with our 3 children. It is in a lovely part of Sultanahmet. Cobbed stoned streets & flower pots everywhere. Our room was very clean & had a view of the Blue Mosque. The terrace has tea/coffee available all day & was lovely to sit & enjoy the view while having a great Turkish breakfast. The reception area is very welcoming with big comfy leather couches & also has a t.v & internet available. The best part was the staff - absolutely fantastic. So happy to help & answer any questions. And there 24/7. Nothing is a problem. Thank you Sharan & team we had a fantastic time & we really appreciated you going out of your way to help us sort out our problem we had at the airport. We would absolutely recommend Oceans 7 to anyone travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis for the Weary Traveller- Just Loved It. 6 Gold Stars”
Reviews.Author: vagabondee
Reviews.Content: My stay came after a fast trawl through Europe and in a sense was keen to get home, but my stay here was endearing. I was so well looked after, a little like stopping over and Grand Parents house and being treated like a king. LOOK NO FURTHER!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, location, and staff”
Reviews.Author: ploftusDC
Reviews.Content: Ocean's 7 is very well organized and the staff actually know everyone who is staying at the hotel and are friendly and laid back. Availability of driver services was very nice. Hotel is only a 3 min walk from Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basillica Cistern, and the Sultanhamet tram stop. Gulhane Park, Topkapki Palace, and the Archeology Museum are also about 5-8 minutes away. Grand Bazar and other Sultanhamet attractions are all about 10 min away. Rooms in hotel are very clean and suitable size. View from the terrace level is great, nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely comfy! A great place to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: sergioph
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ocean's 7 in august 2009 during 5 nights. This hotel is very confortable because it's located very near of the most important places in Istanbul. And above all, it's definetely clean. And last but not least, the staff is incredible. The team of Sharan, Abdul and Ahmet is very friendly and they will help you a lot with any question or problem that you can find in the city. And of course, the lady who cleans is very nice too. Good relation betwen quality and price. A suggestion: go to the Hotel's Restaurant. Good meals and, again, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “We love OceanÂ´s 7!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sselaihi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 9 nights. And we loved it! The people who work there, the surroundings, the service, the relaxed atmosphere, peaceful outdoor chairs. Everything was perfect for us, a family with 4 children between 10 and 17 years. The restaurant, too, was the very best in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Some cool friends for a smart Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LaGarriga
Reviews.Content: It's a pleasure to suggest you this pretty hotel located in the heart of Sultanhamet. Let's me explain the reasons for we liked it so much! 1) That who made Ocean's 7 unique are its employees; they're all young, brilliant, very friendly and super helpful (truely they're there for you and don't worry: if you have any problem or you're in searching of any advice or instruction about what to do and how to organize your journey through Instanbul and Turkey, ask Sharan...it's a master!). 2) You will be sorrounded by the most important and beautiful architectonic and urbanistic beauties of Istanbul (really just a few steps from Aya Sofia, Blue Mosquee, Eminonu and Grand Bazaar...). 3) The Hotel it's cool, well furnished, with nice and comfortable rooms (we stayed here two times in two different rooms...). One impotrant thing is that we noticed with supreme pleasure that the rooms and the common spaces are extremely clean. 4) And last but not least: please, enjoy your breakfast on the terrace admiring the Bosforo and the Blue Mosquee...and naturally eating some Turkysh tastes... That's all... Greetings from Angelo e Orianna (Italy)! Bye...

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly , very helpful , great location.”
Reviews.Author: leonidasgroup
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 4,and we were accomodated in a 4 bedded room. We thought it may be a bit tight but it was very comfortable. The Roof top terrace was lovely and plenty of breakfast food and drinks available. The staff made us feel very welcome and were always helpful , even arranging laundry , The location was perfect as we were close to the blue mosque and the tram network so getting around istanbul was easy. We tried several restuarants and one of our favourites was the ocean's 7 own just around the corner. We have kept the detials and contacts and woudl certainly recommend it and will stay again. Thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: XeX-RO
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for 1 week at Ocean's 7 Hotel during July 2009. It was an excellent choice. The hotel is in the heart of old city (Sultanahmet), at a couple of minutes walk from the main tourist attractions. The staff at the hotel was really friendly and helpful. Theyâ€™ve showed us how to get to the major sights, gave us a map of the city and even paid for the shuttle bus back to the airport. They were always there to assist us in case we needed any help. The room was tidy with a comfortable double bed, a desk, a TV and air conditioning. The breakfast that was included in the price was also great. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Istanbul and feel like home!

Reviews.Title: “Feel like Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Loneshopper
Reviews.Content: First time in Istanbul and felt right at home in Ocean 7. Abdullah, Sharan, Ahmad and Faridz made my stay very easy. Quiet area, very close to major sights in the Old city. Very homey and especially great service. Abdullah and Faridz even got out their way to help me printed my vouchers for the next trip. I would not hesitate to recommend it to my friends and families. Istanbul is a beautiful city, lots of things to see so little time. I definitely will come back, Insya Allah. Good to know you guys, hope to see you again when I come back to Istanbul. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look other place in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: marybull
Reviews.Content: I stay in Ocean's hotel (following reviews in Tripadvisor).it was best choice for stay in Istanbul and Sultanahmet.room was so clean and very quiet ,staff was really so friendly and they make everything to i feel I'm in my home.breakfast was in roof terrace with Bosphoros and blue Mosque view. Thanks for everything guys.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quite little hotel in the heart of Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: dariodub
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent the first two nights of our holiday in Turkey at the Ocean's 7 Hotel. The hotel is in a quiet street in the heart of Sultanhamet. From our window we had a wonderful view of the Blue Mosque, which we could walk to in 5 minutes! The room was very clean, with a supercomfy double bed + 1 extra bed, ensuite bathroom with a large shower and air conditioning although we only had to turn it on once being the room very cool - despite being at the 3rd floor. Above us was the terrace where a rich breakfast was served every morning. From the terrace you have a view of both the Bosforo and the Blue Mosque - wicked! The owner Sharan and all the staff (especially Ahmed) were extremely helpful in giving us directions for monumental places, nightlife, transportation...and narguile :)) The management also owns a hostel and a nice restaurant nearby; hotel guests are given a 15% discount at the restaurant. So enjoyable was our stay that when we got back to Istanbul after travelling around in the country we slept there again. Look no furhter if you are looking for an affordable, lovely accomodation in the wonderful Sultanhamet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality in the middle of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulworld81
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Istanbul. Oceans 7 was an excellent place to stay, a little hotel in the middle of Sultanahmet with all tourist attractions right in the corner. Our room was clean and fine value for money though quite small. We enjoyed the wonderful hospitality of the staff Sharan & Ahmet . Thank you both! Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Ocean 7 was an awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: RawalpindiHamza
Reviews.Content: Checking in Ocean 7 was the best part of my trip to the middle east. Best location with all tourist attractions right in the corner, wonderful hospitality of the staff, friendly enviornment and fantastice blue mosque view right through the room window was like all good things in one! a complete holiday package! We were actually fortunate to get hold of a booking with Ocean 7! we wish them all the very best in all their future transactions also! It would certainly stay on my list whenever I visit istanbul next!

Reviews.Title: “A well located, friendly place in Sulthanamet”
Reviews.Author: Raging_Hamster
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights in a single room at the Oceanâ€™s 7. I booked the room through email and the process was quick and efficient. The hotel is quite well located in Sulthanamet in a not too noisy street and at reasonable walking distance for most of the attractions in the area. Check-in was smooth and the staff very friendly. The room I was given was not too big, but still of adequate size: it had a/c, tv, a desk and a closet with extra blankets/pillows. The bathroom was of good size, albeit being a bit rickety and it was loaded with deodorants, maybe to cover possible bad smells, but no bad smell came from the bathroom while I was there. The shower pressure and temperature were fine both in mornings and evenings. Both rooms were quite clean and bed sheets and towels were fresh. Breakfast is included in the price and itâ€™s served on the rooftop terrace from which is possible to enjoy nice views of the Blue Mosque. The breakfast has a good variety and offers a selection of bread, cheese, cornflakes, fruits and veggies, but I agree with previous reviews in saying that filtered coffee and real orange juice would be welcome changes from nescafeâ€™ and tang. All the people I met at the front desk have been very nice and ready to help in every way they could. Overall, I had a good experience at the Oceanâ€™s 7: itâ€™s a friendly and clean place at a still reasonable price considering Istanbulâ€™s standards.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Chai-bag
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff, clean and cozy rooms, and a nice terrace on the top-- what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch - check other reviews”
Reviews.Author: ethannasr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my wife and I prior to our arrival, notifying them that we would be checking in late due to our evening flight to Istanbul. After we arrived, and specifically after we signed our names to the registration, they told us that the room I had booked was not available for the first night and that they would put us in "another" Ocean's 7 hotel nearby. It was an obvious hassle to arrive late at night and then have to pack our stuff up again in the morning to change not just hotel rooms within one hotel but from entirely different hotels. They kept emphasizing that the rooms were the same but the room they gave us for the first night was a crummy hostel room. It was located right behind the manager's desk in the lobby, with a paper thin door from which you could actually hear the night clerk type on his keyboard (not to mention every other noise from a lobby). The door also had a window (covered in red). Due to the light from the lobby, our room was illuminated all-night long. We should have just left but we were tired from flying into Istanbul and didn't have the energy to look at other nearby hotels at 11pm at night. After reading other reviews, I notice that others reviews have also complained about this practice. After complaining again in the morning, I was told that they would give me "special price" for the room. When we settled up, this also turned into another "misunderstanding." There a numerous hotels in this area at comparable prices so I don't see any reason to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Chini04
Reviews.Content: We spent four really good days in Istambul in may 09. Oceans 7 was an excellent place to stay, clean, homely, well located, friendly staff, nice roof terrace ... Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for an Istanbul Stay"”
Reviews.Author: sampal
Reviews.Content: I, my wife and two boys (10, 11) stayed at Oceans 7 hotel in Istanbul for 3 nights, May 9, 10 and 11, 2009. I did not know anything about Istanbul and I booked this hotel purely on the basis of the reviews I saw on the Internet. This turned out to be the perfect hotel for us. Having traveled all over the world, I am not much for glitzy, high-end hotels that have impersonal service. Oceans 7 felt like home. We were welcomed by Ahmet and Sharan each time we stepped into the hotel. Ahmet and Sharan acted like friends rather than hotel staff. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff very friendly. The location is perfect! While we saw loads of tourist buses unload visitors at Blue Mosque or Aya Sophia, we used to walk 3 mins from our hotel to these locations. The trams are close by. There is really no need to book a guided tour or a walking tour. With Oceans7, you are already where all the tourist attractions are! I would highly recommend Oceans7 to anyone going to Istanbul as a tourist. Oceans7 will make you feel welcome in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “One Thousand and One Nights”
Reviews.Author: Lucky-Munich
Reviews.Content: During a twelve days stay in Istanbul, we had the chance to enjoy the charme and friendlyness in Ocean's 7 Hotel. With view onto the Blue Mosque and the Marmara Sea, we had a great and delicious breakfast in the top floor breakfast romm or terrace, the rooms are nice and clean. Sharan, the sales manager, and Ahmet or one of his brothers were always ready to assist their guests. Perfectly situated in a quiet road of the Sultanahmet Old Town of Istanbul near the Blue Mosque and Aghia Sofia. A great time at a great place! I would be pleased to return there.

Reviews.Title: “My first time in Istambul, perfect choses...”
Reviews.Author: gazzy27
Reviews.Content: Very nice sightseeing on Marmara Sea and Blue Mosk from its terrace, Sharan gave us very sharp and useful information. The position is perfect to visit most of the attraction of this magic city, and very closed to Arasta bazzar, a little but very nice place where make short loounches, little shopping, or where smoking the waterpipe while drinking a perfect turkish tea and watching dervish dancing. I recommend this little and familiar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: szmarck
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here, and was the best choice I could make, not just concerning the price and the location, but what's its best merit is the people who run the hotel. Genuine kind people, who are there to help you in every situation. You'll be pleased I assure you! Thanks for everything guys!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalgOsia28
Reviews.Content: We are family with two adult daughters. We spent 9 days in Istanbul, in Oceans's seven hotel and it was very nice time. The hotel is very located in the very center of Sultanahmet, close to the historical buildings and many restaurants and shops but the street is very quite. The staf is very friendly, and we really liked them all. The only problem was very small room, but the price was excellent .... We would recommend this place to everybody who seeks small, family-run, friendly hotel for a reasonalby price. PaveÅ‚, MaÅ‚gorzata, Ewa and Zuzanna

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: matevzh
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a very good location, close to main tourist sites and still in quiet street not to be disturbed by outside noise. It is an OK hotel (i would also recommend it to a friend) with large enough rooms, good breakfast and excellent staff. Room was quite spacious with decent size bathroom, both simple and functional. However, it would need some redecoration, as it was worn down on some spots. A plummer would be needed in a bathroom, as quite unpleasant smell was coming from toilet. But, all in all, room was fine and clean. Breakfast was good with variety, however we would prefer "proper" cofffee and freshly squezzed juice. Terrace is nice with nice view on a blue mosque. You will appreciate the open part to enjoy the morning sun. Again, staff was very helpful at breakfast. Staff was also very helpul with other information and needs, therefore i can give them only the highest marks on that. I would say that hotel is value for money for listed price on internet. For the price we were charged i would expect more, but that was also our problem not to book ahead in high season. Bottom line... Recommended hostel which is an OK and pleasant stay, but lacks that special something to make it excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Best place to stay at Istanbul if don't want to spend much ;)”
Reviews.Author: Nube_Leon
Reviews.Content: I went alone there and definetely i did enjoy my stay there! is very confortable, clean, has an excellent location, good price,I was so close to Blue Mosque and other famous locations :), service was great, people were so gentle and they were always there for me if i needed any recommendation or help. I would like to thank all the staff for making my stay one of my best memories during my trip :D I can say I made new good friends. ohhh and The restaurant is soooooo good!!! I LIKED SO MUCH THE FOOD THERE :P I LOVE THAT RESTAURANT.. I have to come back there for sure and 1 gossip for girls: The guys there.... are very handsome! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly and helpful people.”
Reviews.Author: Dougindorset
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Ocean 7 and had absolutely no problems. It is central to everything : sightseeing musts, good restaurants and even cinemas. Good breakfasts overlooking The Blue Mosque. Sure, the rooms could have been bigger but you get what you pay for. Sharan, the manager and Ahmet were both extremely helpful. You need more breakfast coffee, towels etc. just ask, they will gladly sort it. In short, good basic value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dara80
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotel ocean's 7 at my last bussiness trip in Istanbul. I'd like to thank to all it's employees and managment. they have great service, perfect location in the middle of the historical Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location, the friendliest staff :)”
Reviews.Author: kjerstilsk
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing! Just a two minute walk from blue mosq, st. sophia, many more attractions. Despite being so central, the area was very quiet, so no problem getting a good nights sleep. Breakfast at the roofterrace was very enjoyable with good food, excellent views and nice staff. The rooms were a bit nice, but a bit small. That wasnt a problem, cause when you are in Istanbul you wount be spending a lot of time in your room. The tramline is situated a five minute walk away, so its vey easy to get around town. The staff must also be mentioned. They were always at hand trying to make our stay as enjoyable as possible, so a big thanks to everyone, especially the manager, Sharan :) I would love to go back, and would absolutely recommend anyone to take a trip to Istanbul and stay at the Ocean's 7 hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “The Ocean's 7 the Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Zinou75
Reviews.Content: Really I enjoyed once I been in the Ocean's 7 Hotel, is Quiet, Familiar people, Helpfull, Clear Rooms and Kitchen, is located in the Deep of Sultan Ahmet city near the most famous historic places in Istanbul, just try it and you will feel happy, is like a big House and over than the great reception and kind services provided by the agents overthere, they have all what you need orientation, advises trust me I enjoyed my stay in the Ocean's 7. Athmane-Algeria

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ShaksLondon
Reviews.Content: My time in Ocean's was fantastic and one which myself and my friends will always remember. It was the place where we all found out that we passed our Final medical exams and became Doctors. The staff were extremely friendly especially Ahmed, who always looked out for us during our stay in Turkey. I have already recommended it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel :D”
Reviews.Author: Sophi1991
Reviews.Content: I liked it very much in the Hotel Oceans 7. The People/Staff are very nice and helpful , the rooms are clean and from our hotel room we had a great view to the blue mosque (so the hotel has got a very good position.. near the blue mosque and the hagia sophia..) :)) Thanks for everything, Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: piispa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the old town of Istanbul. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and tramway to all other important sites are in 5-10 minutes' walking distance. The hearty Turkish style breakfast buffet (tea is very good but instant coffee is terrible..) is included in the price. Our street side room was rather small. The large and very good double bed covered about half of the room. The sounds of living outside the hotel did not disturb us, but voices of the incoming hotel guests irritated. The staff of the hotel was friendly and helpful. We had dinner every night in the Ocean's 7 Restaurant (100 m. from the hotel) enjoying good meals and excellent service. The worst point of our stay was the toilet. The cleaning was insufficient, the towels were changed and the toilet paper was added only once in 4 days, and a bad smell spread from the toilet into the room. Of course, we should have complained about these problems...

Reviews.Title: “Service like I have never experienced before!”
Reviews.Author: osatrevor
Reviews.Content: I was in Turkey in March with my family and we spent the majority of our trip at Ocean's 7. From the moment I checked in the service was unbelievable. They let me check in 12 hours early and stay the night at no extra charge. Anything I needed, they did it for me. Being as it was my first trip this was a huge help. They were 100% trustworthy. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the view of the Blue Mosque was fantastic. Breakfast was delicious and they kept it open for us longer than the advertised hours, very nice if you happen to sleep in! ;0) But the moment that stuck out most to me was my last day at the hotel. Ahmet invited myself and my brother to join him for shisha and tea. He took us to a very classy place, order shisha, two rounds for tea, and food. As he was just a worker at the hotel and not the owner I assumed that we would all share the cost, or that maybe he would pick up the shisha and we would share the rest. No. He picked up the whole tab. Incridible! He made me feel like a long time friend not a hotel guest. That was really special.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hosts ever + Blue Mosque out your window + Very comfortable + Great value”
Reviews.Author: J_yyyyyyyy
Reviews.Content: The 2 most important features of staying here are (1) the hosts, Shahram + Ahmet - our family of 5 loves these guys and wants them to visit us and (2) the fact that you are in the heart of old Istanbul. The Blue Mosque greeted us each day with our tasty rooftop breakfast and from our son's bedroom window. It's just a few minutes to walk there and to the Haghia Sophia - a perfect location. We were very comfortable. The only thing I would say is that when you first arrive, the lobby may not seem as coiffed as it appears in the photos but it's all very clean and when we looked around at other hotels in this price range I knew we made the right choice. I can't say enough about how kind and attentive our hosts were. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The owners (Shahram and Ahmet) are amazing - you must visit this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheHerbertClan
Reviews.Content: I drove from Bucharest Romania with my three children and was exhausted fromt the trip... Shahram helped me tremendously with getting to the hotel. We arrived much later than expected and we were starving! Shahram walked us to the Ocean's 7 restaurant for a wonderful feast! We stayed in a family room...perfect for us... the bathroom is a little small... but perfectly okay. Shahram and Ahmet met every need we had... extra towels, toilet paper, extending us another day...even to bring my passport to the police station from being pickpocketed! My kids loved the hotel and didn't want to leave... the breakfast was wonderful and I think my kids would have sat there all day and ate! The customer service was key for me as well as feeling like you were a part of the family! Would love to come back some day soon and stay again. Would love to see if you all can maybe add two services to the hotel.... exchanging money to Lira and being able to buy tram tokens as well... then customers can do everything right in the hotel!! Miss you all very much! Chrissy, Emily, Kyle and William

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: S-zinha
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ocean's 7 over New Year 2008/2009 and thought it was superb. It is in an excellent location; taking just minutes to stroll to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It is also only a short walk to the nearest tram stop making many other tourist destinations easily accessible. The hotel itself is clean and well-equiped. New Year in Istanbul is cold and I was glad to have a warm, comfortable room to retreat to when I needed. It was also good to be able to head up to the enclosed roof-top area and make myself a coffee when I fancied one. Breakfast is not fancy, but is plentiful. What really makes this hotel special, however, is the staff. They are very friendly and really couldn't do enough for me. Whenever I had a problem or a query it was dealt with immediately. They seemed genuinely interested in how I was and what I planned to do each day, and offered invaluable advice on where to go, what to see and where to eat and drink. I still have the little street map that Sharan annotated for me! I thoroughly enjoyed New Year in Istanbul and am very glad I chose Ocean's 7. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous city...”
Reviews.Author: zoltan_kosa_s1
Reviews.Content: This was the first city where we stayed at a hotel instead of renting out an apartment, so I was a little concerned. The hotel was a very positive surprise, a quiet island in the bustling city. Clean rooms and a very helpful, kind and informal staff. From the room you could see the blue mosque and from the balcony there was the view of the Bosporus: it was pretty difficult to leave the room in the mornings. I can only recommend it to everyone. Thanks, guys!

Reviews.Title: “Best I ever had in istanbul.A little bit as at home.”
Reviews.Author: sabinestolzi
Reviews.Content: It was my 12's time in Istanbul. And as a woman alone on the way ,I saw much terrible things on my trips before.(Dirt,unfriendly staff,ugly rooms.........) In ocean's 7 everything was different. Absolut clean hotel.Towels are changed,you cant use them so fast ;-) Room with TV, very good mattress and heating. Near the tramway and all historical places near by. When you start your day,it would be with a view over the bosporus and Sultanahmet Mosque in the breakfirst room on the roof. But the outstanding thing in this hotel is the staff. They helped were they could and made my big problems totaly small. Thank you Sharan and Ahmet so much. I will come back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Musicaltravellers
Reviews.Content: This is a compact hotel - very well situated and with views from the roof breakfast room to the Blue Mosque. The rooms were clean and recently decorated, and we were offered a more spacious room on the second day - just because it became available! The restaurant that belongs to the family is just around the corner and really great - cosy and good food - I especially enjoyed the veggie options. However the BIG plus of a small family hotel like this is the staff! They went out of their way to help us and make sure we had everything we needed - and to let us use their printer - internet is already available, and to organise transport at the best rate, and to reassure us when a bag was lost - both in the restaurant and in the hotel they went beyond the call of duty. Shahram the manager could not have helped us more and it transformed a rainy wintery Istanbul break into a weekend with friends!

Reviews.Title: “Evicted with no warning!”
Reviews.Author: mickywagner
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were informed we would be staying in the guest house near by. On the surface this place was clean and tidy but the room was poorly lit, in fact it was virtually pitch black and we had to ask everyday for new toilet rolls and clean towls and for our miniscule bin to be emptied. Our sheets were not changed once over our four night stay which i was surprised about. This place was marketed as a hotel not a hostel. The staff were generally quite accomodating with our requests until the last morning. At around 11am one of the brothers/ owners came tou our room and asked if we wanted to book an airport shuttle service through him. We did and handed over our money. We informed them we would be going out and back around 3pm in order to get the shuttle by 4pm, he told us this would be fine. When we arrived back they told us we couldn't go to our room and handed us our passports. These had been placed in a drawer, not in the middle of the room. At this point we realised they had checked us out of our room with out our knowledge and just piled our stuff up outside the door. We were told that check out was at 10:30 and we should be thankful they hadn't charged us for the extra day. We were shocked! The man stood in our room and took our money after 10:30am and didn't mention a thing! Had we known we would have happily been packed by that time but the fact that they had been in our room, packed our belongings and been through our things was a complete violation. One of our concerns was that they had forgotten something at which point they allowed us to enter the room which we had stayed in, and where new people had been checked into, and check the room! This is a complete violation of the current occupants privacy and space! At this point we heard a distressed woman downstairs also complaining about her room claiming that she had been promised our room, but the hotel/hostel had told her the man staying there had missed his flight. Seeing as we were a group of three girls and had been scheduled to leave that day and not the day before it was plain to see we'd all been lied to. This left us with a bitter taste in our mouths and an upsetting end to what was otherwise a brilliant trip. Go to istanbul, just don't stay at Oceans 7!!

HotelInfo.Name: Ocean's 7 Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Mimar mehmet aga St.Amiral tafdil Sk.No:18 / 1 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
